thread.title: Men's Basketball Falls Late to Jacksonville State on the Road
thread.title_full: Men's Basketball Falls Late to Jacksonville State on the Road

author: @@FIUHoops
title: Men's Basketball Falls Late to Jacksonville State on the Road
text: Box Score 67 FIU FIU 7-14,1-7 CUSA 71 Winner Jacksonville St. JSU 14-7,6-2 CUSA FIU FIU 7-14,1-7 CUSA 67 Final Jan. 30, 2025 71 Jacksonville St. JSU 14-7,6-2 CUSA Winner Score By Periods Team 1 2 F FIU FIU 34 33 67 Jacksonville St. JSU 36 35 71 Game Recap: Men's Basketball | 1/30/2025 10:20:00 PM Men’s Basketball Falls Late to Jacksonville State on the Road Jayden Brewer led FIU with 15 points JACKSONVILLE, Ala. — FIU's men's basketball program was defeated in a tightly-contested Conference USA (CUSA) tilt on the road on Thursday evening, 71-67. The Panthers (7-14, 1-7 CUSA) led the Gamecocks (14-7, 6-2 CUSA) 63-62 with 3:53 to go following a layup from Jayden Brewer. Jax State went back in front by one with 2:38 remaining and followed that with a stop and clutch three-pointer to seal the result, finishing off a four-point victory. Jayden Brewer had 15 points to lead the FIU offense, going 6-for-11 from the field in 29 minutes. Vianney Salatchoum added 14 points and eight rebounds, blocking three shots. Jonathan Aybar and Dante Wilcox were both in double-figures with 10 points each. As a team, FIU out-rebounded a strong rebounding JSU team, 38-29, racking up 13 offensive rebounds. The Panthers shot 46.6 percent from the field, but shot just 4-for-15 from the three-point line and 9-for-14 from the free throw line. In the first half, the Gamecocks built an early seven-point lead, ahead 13-6 with 14:13 to go in the opening frame. Jax State maintained this advantage for much of the first half, increasing its margin to eight with 2:51 left. Down 36-28, the Panthers used a 6-0 run to close the half to pull within two, down 36-34 at the break. To open the second half, the Gamecocks again raced out to an eight-point lead at the 12:56 mark. A furious 8-0 run for FIU quickly tied the game at 53-all, setting the stage for a wild finish. UP NEXT FIU takes on Kennesaw State on the road on Saturday, Feb. 1 at 5 p.m. SOCIAL MEDIA Fans are encouraged to follow the Panthers on Instagram (@FIUHoops), Twitter (@FIUHoops), and Facebook (Facebook.com/FIUMensBball) for all the latest Men's Basketball news. General athletic news can also be found at @FIUSports on Facebook and @FIUAthletics on Twitter and Instagram. Print Friendly Version
